intro: Epilobium psilotum, commonly known as slender willow-herb, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs. The flowers are usually pink or red, with four petals, and produce small, capsule-like fruits.
